docs.text: About sChat ¶ sChat is a chat plugin for Minecraft using a unique technique to split up messy chats into tabs. Like in other games the flooded Minecraft chat will be no more. Click to see sChat in action. Features ¶ sChat comes with the following features out of the box and can be extended using its API . Multi-Platform Support Bukkit/Spigot/Paper Bungeecord Velocity Seperate Tabs for each conversation keeping the chat clean Network-wide Global Channels Network-wide Global Private Chats PlaceholderAPI Support

docs.text: Commands ¶ Most of the UI elements in sChat can be interacted with by clicking on them. Under the hood they executed the comes that are listed below. Player Commands ¶ Here is a list of player commands. Note All players will have the schat.player permission by default granting them access to the following commands. Command Alias Permission Description Since /channel join <channel> /ch <channel> schat.player.channel.join Joins the given channel or sets it as active channel. next /channel leave <channel> /leave <channel> schat.player.channel.leave Leaves the given channel. next /channel message <channel> <message> /ch <channel> <message> schat.player.channel.quickmessage Sends a message to the given channel without switching to it. next /tell <player> [message] /m , /w , /pm , /dm schat.player.directmessage Sends a message to the given player or opens the conversation. next Admin Commands ¶ As an admin you have access to the following commands. Commands Alias Permission Description Since /schat reload schat.admin.reload Reloads the sChat config and all channels that changed. This is non disruptive and will not touch unchanged channels. next

docs.text: Installation ¶ sChat requires at least Java 17 and ProtocolLib ( on the bukkit platform ). After these prerequisites are met download sChat and drop it into the plugins/ folder. Restart the server and you are done. Multi-Server Networks If you have a multi server setup using Bungeecord or Velocity , then download the plugin for the proxy and restart the proxy as well. Initial Configuration ¶ sChat comes with two preconfigured channels: global and team . The latter can only be accessed by players that have the schat.channel.team.join permission. It is protected . Both channels are global and forward messages to all servers. Here is a quick overview of the channel configuration. Each setting is explained in great detail in the channel configuration section. Global Channel Config channels : global : name : "<#189AB4>Global" # colors the name with the given hex formatted color settings : protected : false # the channel can be joined without a permission auto_join : true # the channel is added automatically to players global : true # messages are forwarded to all servers on the network forced : true # the channel cannot be left team : name : "Team" settings : protected : true # the channel can only be joined with the 'schat.channel.team.join' permission auto_join : true global : true forced : false # players can leave the channel if they wish You can reload the channel configuration on-the-fly with the /schat reload command. Do I need to set all options of a channel for it to be valid? No. The only thing you need to configure for a valid channel is the name. channels : minimal : name : Minimal What do I need to configure on the proxy? The proxy does not require any configuration and only serves as a message relay between servers. This might change in the future. But for know you don't need to touch the proxy config. Full config.yml ¶ Here is the complete config.yml how it is shipped with the plugin. sChat will automatically save and overwrite a config.default.yml on every start. The default config always contains the latest settings. You can also take a look at the configuration reference to see which options exist and when they were added. config.yml ################################################################################################## #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| _________ .__ __ |# #| _____\_ ___ \| |__ _____ _/ |_ |# #| / ___/ \ \/| | \\__ \\ __\ |# #| \___ \\ \___| Y \/ __ \| | |# #| /____ >\______ |___| (____ |__| |# #| \/ \/ \/ \/ |# #| |# #| Supercharge your Minecraft Chat Experience! |# #| |# #| WIKI: https://github.com/sVoxelDev/sChat |# #| DISCORD: https://discord.gg/R4st4QxAjb |# #| BUG REPORTS: https://github.com/sVoxelDev/sChat/issues |# #| |# #| New options are not added to this file automatically. Default values are used if an |# #| option cannot be found. There will always be an up-to-date config.default.yml which |# #| also explains all of the available config options in detail. |# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# ################################################################################################## #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| CHANNELS |# #| ------------ |# #| This is the main part where you configure all the chat channels on your server. |# #| The channels need to be configured on every server. Global channels are synced automatically.|# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# channels : # # This is the unique key of the channel. # # Every channel needs a key that must be unique across servers and # only contains letters, numbers, dashes (-) or underscores (_). # # The key is used when referencing the channel, e.g. in commands and permission nodes. # global : # # The friendly display name of the channel as it is shown in the GUI and messages. # The name is parsed with the MiniMessage format (see documentation). # name : "<#189AB4>Global" # colors the name with the given hex formatted color # # Every channel can have an unlimited number of settings added and controlled by various features. # The settings documented here are the ones that come out of the box with sChat. # settings : # # Channels can be 'protected' to require a special permission to join. # The permission is composed of the channel key: 'schat.channel.<key>.join'. # This 'global' channel would require the 'schat.channel.global.join' permission if 'protected: true' is set. # # default: false # protected : false # # Channels with the 'auto_join' setting are automatically added to players when they join the server # if they have the permission to join the channel. # # default: false # auto_join : true # # 'global' channels are automatically synchronized across servers. # Messages sent to global channels are forwarded to all other servers in the network. # This requires the Bungeecord or Velocity sChat plugin. See the 'messenger' configuration below for more details. # # default: true # global : true # # A 'forced' channel cannot be left by players. # Combined with 'auto_join' makes for perfect server wide default channels. # # default: false # forced : true #+-------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| CHANNEL MESSAGE FORMAT |# #| ---------------------------- |# #| Controls the format of messages sent to the channel. |# #| |# #| Wiki: https://docs.adventure.kyori.net/minimessage/format.html |# #| Web Viewer: https://bit.ly/3hpYRQF |# #| |# #+-------------------------------------------------------------------+# # # The 'message_format' is used to format messages NOT sent by the viewer. # You can use the full power of MiniMessage (see above) and PlaceholderAPI placeholders. # message_format : "<yellow><hover:show_text:'<gray>Click to send <yellow><source.diplay_name></yellow> a message.\n<gray>Since: <aqua>%player_first_played_formatted%'><click:run_command:'/tell <source.name>'><source.display_name></click></yellow><gray>: <text>" team : name : Team settings : protected : true auto_join : true global : true forced : false message_format : "<#189AB4><source.display_name><gray>: <text>" #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| PRIVATE MESSAGES |# #| ------------ |# #| Configure the behaviour of private chats here. |# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# private_chat : #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| VIEW CONFIGURATION |# #| ------------ |# #| Configure the behaviour of private chats here. |# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# view : messenger : pluginmessage Next Steps ¶ Now that you are setup, you have one of many options: take a look at the commands and permissions deep dive into the configuration or get started with the developer API May the Force be with you

docs.text: Permissions ¶ sChat bundles its permissions into schat.player ( default: true ) and schat.admin ( default: OP ) permissions. Player Permissions ¶ Every player has the following permissions by default. Info You need to negate the schat.player permission if you only want to give players access to a portion of the player commands and features. Permission Description Since schat.player This permission grouping contains all of the schat.player.* permissions. It is applied to all players by default. next schat.player.channel.join Allows the player to join channels. This can be further restricted with individual channel permissions. next schat.player.channel.leave Allows the player to leave channels. next schat.player.channel.quickmessage Enables the player to send quick messages ( /ch <channel> <message> ) to channels he is allowed to write in. next schat.player.directmessage Allows the player to send direct messages ( /dm <player> <message> ) to other players. next Admin Permissions ¶ These are the additional permissions for admins. Permission Description Since schat.admin This permission groups all admin permissions nested under the schat.admin.* permissions. OPs get this by default. next schat.admin.reload Allows performing the /schat reload command to reload the plugin. next

docs.text: Channels ¶ Channels are the core component of sChat and organize the message flood into tabs. The channels need to be configured in the config.yml under the channels section. Every channel can have a range of settings that are explained below. Other plugins can extend that functionality and add custom settings. Important Global channels must be configured the same on all servers to work properly. You can use the /schat reload command to reload your channels on the fly after you have made changes. channels : # all channels must go under the channels section my_channel : # every channel needs a unique key that must only contain letters, numbers, underscores or dashes name : My Channel # the channel also needs a name that can be of any format and is parsed as a minimessage settings : ... # all channel specific settings go here Settings ¶ Every channel can have any or all of the following settings. Note Default values are marked with a . priority ¶ next · int | 100 The priority of the channel controls its position in the tabs and commands. The lower the priority value the higher up the channel appears. Channels with the same priority are sorted by their name. Example channels : aaa : settings : priority : 20 bbb : settings : priority : 10 cbb : name : ccc caa : name : ccc The channels are sorted in the following way: | bbb | aaa | caa | cbb | protected ¶ next · true | false Protected channels can only be joined by players that have the schat.channel.<key>.join permission. For example the team channel requires the schat.channel.team.join permission. join_permission ¶ next · string | schat.channel.<key>.join You can override the required join permission with this setting. Info This setting only works if protected: true is also set. global ¶ next · true | false Messages that are sent to a global channel are forwarded with the configured messenger . hidden ¶ next · true | false Hides the channel in commands, auto completion and listings. Does not prevent joining or leaving the channel. Players that are joined to the channel will see it in the channel tabs like all other channels. auto_join ¶ next · true | false If enabled players will automatically join the channel when they join the server. Only channels the player has access to will be auto joined. Note If the players leaves an auto_join channel and rejoins the server, the channel is joined again. This option is therefor best combined with the forced setting. forced ¶ next · true | false Forced channels cannot be left by players. Format ¶ The following settings are all formatting options and parsed with the MiniMessage format . They go under the normal settings section like all other options. message_format ¶ next · Experimental · string The message format controls how message are displayed for the given channel. In addition to the PlacerholderAPI , the following placeholders are supported: Tip With sChat you have something completly new: Tabbed Chat Channels This gives you the power to declutter your chat and remove the now unneeded [Channel] prefix from the messages. Placeholder Description Example Since <id> The unique id of the message. 66ad5e0d-ed28-4601-bcde-617b6729b5b3 next <timestamp> The timestamp when the message was sent. 2021-05-01T12:10:55.412386200Z next <type> The type of the message. SYSTEM or CHAT next <text> The text of the message. Hi there! next <source.uuid> The ID of the message sender. dd5c4f63-b5d9-43e7-9584-40b25494d7e8 next <source.name> The name of the message sender. docs.text: Channels are the core component of sChat and organize the message flood into tabs. The channels need to be configured in the config.yml under the channels section. Every channel can have a range of settings that are explained below. Other plugins can extend that functionality and add custom settings. Important Global channels must be configured the same on all servers to work properly. You can use the /schat reload command to reload your channels on the fly after you have made changes. channels : # all channels must go under the channels section my_channel : # every channel needs a unique key that must only contain letters, numbers, underscores or dashes name : My Channel # the channel also needs a name that can be of any format and is parsed as a minimessage settings : ... # all channel specific settings go here
docs.title: Channels

docs.text: Every channel can have any or all of the following settings. Note Default values are marked with a .
docs.title: Settings

docs.text: next · int | 100 The priority of the channel controls its position in the tabs and commands. The lower the priority value the higher up the channel appears. Channels with the same priority are sorted by their name. Example channels : aaa : settings : priority : 20 bbb : settings : priority : 10 cbb : name : ccc caa : name : ccc The channels are sorted in the following way: | bbb | aaa | caa | cbb |
docs.title: priority

docs.text: next · true | false Protected channels can only be joined by players that have the schat.channel.<key>.join permission. For example the team channel requires the schat.channel.team.join permission.
docs.title: protected

docs.text: next · string | schat.channel.<key>.join You can override the required join permission with this setting. Info This setting only works if protected: true is also set.
docs.title: join_permission

docs.text: next · true | false Messages that are sent to a global channel are forwarded with the configured messenger .
docs.title: global

docs.text: next · true | false Hides the channel in commands, auto completion and listings. Does not prevent joining or leaving the channel. Players that are joined to the channel will see it in the channel tabs like all other channels.
docs.title: hidden

docs.text: next · true | false If enabled players will automatically join the channel when they join the server. Only channels the player has access to will be auto joined. Note If the players leaves an auto_join channel and rejoins the server, the channel is joined again. This option is therefor best combined with the forced setting.
docs.title: auto_join

docs.text: next · true | false Forced channels cannot be left by players.
docs.title: forced

docs.text: The following settings are all formatting options and parsed with the MiniMessage format . They go under the normal settings section like all other options.
docs.title: Format

In addition to the PlacerholderAPI , the following placeholders are supported: Tip With sChat you have something completly new: Tabbed Chat Channels This gives you the power to declutter your chat and remove the now unneeded [Channel] prefix from the messages. SYSTEM or CHAT next <text> The text of the message. Hi there! next <source.uuid> The ID of the message sender. dd5c4f63-b5d9-43e7-9584-40b25494d7e8 next <source.name> The name of the message sender. Silthus next <source.display_name> The formatted display or nickname of the sender. &aSilthus next <channel.key> The unique key of the channel. global next <channel.display_name> The formatted name of the channel. Global next Example with Name Hover and PlaceholderAPI channels : global : name : <green>Global settings : message_format : "<aqua>[<channel.name>]</aqua>%vault_prefix%<hover:show_text:'<source.display_name>\n<gray>Rank: <aqua>%vault_rank%'><source.display_name></hover>%vault_suffix%<gray>: <text>"

docs.text: MiniMessage Format ¶ The MiniMessage Format is a special parser that makes reading formatted messages a lot easier. Tip You can use the MiniMessage Web Viewer to test your formats and preview them without a running server. Examples ¶ The following examples all set the message_format of the channel. Formatting the messages sent to the channel. Info You can click on the images to open the web viewer with the example and play around with it. message_format : "<yellow><source.display_name><gray>: <text>" message_format : "<hover:show_text:'<source.name>'><source.display_name></hover> > <#fa9411><text>" message_format : "<yellow><source.name>: <gradient:#5e4fa2:#f79459:red><text></gradient>" Tip Visit the official MiniMessage Documentation for even more cool features and in depth explanation.

docs.text: Configuration Reference ¶ These are all of the available config options for sChat. Looking for the channel settings? Head over to the seperate channel configuration section. General Settings ¶ debug ¶ next · true | false Set to true and restart your server to produce an enormous amount of debug logs. debug : true Private Chat ¶ The following options control how private chats behave. All config options reside under the private_chat section. private_chat : ... message_format ¶ next · Experimental · Reloadable · string Controls how messages are displayed inside private chats. By default this will render the name of the chat partner and You: . MiniMessage Format The format is parsed as a MiniMessage . See the MiniMessage documentation for details. private_chat : message_format : "<dark_aqua><<yellow><source.display_name><dark_aqua>> <gray><text>" Global Chatting ¶ The following settings control how global chatting works. Changing one of these settings requires a restart of all affected servers and the proxy. messenger ¶ next · string The messenger controls how global messages are forwarded to the other servers in the network. Type Description Since pluginmessage Messages are sent thru the Plugin Messaging Channel to the proxy. The proxy then forwards them to all other servers in the network. sChat must be installed on the proxy for this to work. next messenger : "pluginmessage" Invalid Messenger An invalid messenger type will prevent your server from starting.

docs.text: PlaceholderAPI ¶ The very popular PlaceholderAPI plugin allows the use of placeholders in various text formats and messages. A placeholder could be the current world, biome, player level, money or any other information provided by plugins supporting the PlaceholderAPI. Placeholders can be used inside the message_format of channels . Example The following examples displays the player's rank and money inside the hover. Colors have been omitted on puprose to make the snippet smaller. See the MiniMessage Format documentation for more formatting options. message_format : "Money: %vault_eco_balance_formatted%'>: "

docs.text: Here is the complete config.yml how it is shipped with the plugin. sChat will automatically save and overwrite a config.default.yml on every start. The default config always contains the latest settings. You can also take a look at the configuration reference to see which options exist and when they were added. config.yml ################################################################################################## #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| _________ .__ __ |# #| _____\_ ___ \| |__ _____ _/ |_ |# #| / ___/ \ \/| | \\__ \\ __\ |# #| \___ \\ \___| Y \/ __ \| | |# #| /____ >\______ |___| (____ |__| |# #| \/ \/ \/ \/ |# #| |# #| Supercharge your Minecraft Chat Experience! |# #| |# #| WIKI: https://github.com/sVoxelDev/sChat |# #| DISCORD: https://discord.gg/R4st4QxAjb |# #| BUG REPORTS: https://github.com/sVoxelDev/sChat/issues |# #| |# #| New options are not added to this file automatically. Default values are used if an |# #| option cannot be found. There will always be an up-to-date config.default.yml which |# #| also explains all of the available config options in detail. |# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# ################################################################################################## #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| CHANNELS |# #| ------------ |# #| This is the main part where you configure all the chat channels on your server. |# #| The channels need to be configured on every server. Global channels are synced automatically.|# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# channels : # # This is the unique key of the channel. # # Every channel needs a key that must be unique across servers and # only contains letters, numbers, dashes (-) or underscores (_). # # The key is used when referencing the channel, e.g. in commands and permission nodes. # global : # # The friendly display name of the channel as it is shown in the GUI and messages. # The name is parsed with the MiniMessage format (see documentation). # name : "<#189AB4>Global" # colors the name with the given hex formatted color # # Every channel can have an unlimited number of settings added and controlled by various features. # The settings documented here are the ones that come out of the box with sChat. # settings : # # Channels can be 'protected' to require a special permission to join. # The permission is composed of the channel key: 'schat.channel.<key>.join'. # This 'global' channel would require the 'schat.channel.global.join' permission if 'protected: true' is set. # # default: false # protected : false # # Channels with the 'auto_join' setting are automatically added to players when they join the server # if they have the permission to join the channel. # # default: false # auto_join : true # # 'global' channels are automatically synchronized across servers. # Messages sent to global channels are forwarded to all other servers in the network. # This requires the Bungeecord or Velocity sChat plugin. See the 'messenger' configuration below for more details. # # default: true # global : true # # A 'forced' channel cannot be left by players. # Combined with 'auto_join' makes for perfect server wide default channels. # # default: false # forced : true #+-------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| CHANNEL MESSAGE FORMAT |# #| ---------------------------- |# #| Controls the format of messages sent to the channel. |# #| |# #| Wiki: https://docs.adventure.kyori.net/minimessage/format.html |# #| Web Viewer: https://bit.ly/3hpYRQF |# #| |# #+-------------------------------------------------------------------+# # # The 'message_format' is used to format messages NOT sent by the viewer. # You can use the full power of MiniMessage (see above) and PlaceholderAPI placeholders. # message_format : "<yellow><hover:show_text:'<gray>Click to send <yellow><source.diplay_name></yellow> a message.\n<gray>Since: <aqua>%player_first_played_formatted%'><click:run_command:'/tell <source.name>'><source.display_name></click></yellow><gray>: <text>" team : name : Team settings : protected : true auto_join : true global : true forced : false message_format : "<#189AB4><source.display_name><gray>: <text>" #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| PRIVATE MESSAGES |# #| ------------ |# #| Configure the behaviour of private chats here. |# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# private_chat : #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# #| |# #| VIEW CONFIGURATION |# #| ------------ |# #| Configure the behaviour of private chats here. |# #+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+# view : messenger : pluginmessage
